intro: Hieracium erythrodontum, commonly known as the red-toothed hawkweed, is a perennial flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as meadows, roadsides, and waste areas. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while the flowers consist of yellow ray florets surrounding a central disk. Hieracium erythrodontum is known for its ability to thrive in a variety of soil types and its resilience to environmental stress.
